properties.areaDesc: Oakland; Washtenaw; Lenawee; Monroe; Macomb; Wayne; Livingston
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 17 at 3:56PM EST until January 18 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Detroit/Pontiac MI
properties.description:
...A WINTER STORM SYSTEM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEAST MICHIGAN LATE
FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY MORNING...

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8
inches by Saturday afternoon, with peak snowfall rates in excess
of an inch per hour throughout the early morning hours on
Saturday. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph.

* WHERE...Livingston, Macomb, Washtenaw, Lenawee, Monroe, Oakland
and Wayne Counties.

* WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to noon EST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions likely through the morning.
Drastic reductions to visibility expected under periods of heavy
snow.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will begin Friday night and become
heaviest during the 2 AM to 9 AM timeframe on Saturday.
Increasing temperatures in the late morning will coincide with a
changeover to sleet or a wintry mix before warmer air
transitions precipitation to rain or drizzle by mid afternoon.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON EST SATURDAY
